lead_paragraph: A partnership between Constellation Energy and Electricité de France to build a new reactor in Maryland has broken up, with Constellation concluding that the economics are unfavorable because of electricity market conditions and the terms demanded by the Energy Department for a loan guarantee.
snippet: Constellation has backed out of its planned nuclear venture with Electricité de France, and U.S. law requires that every nuclear plant have an American partner as a majority owner.

headline.main: Anyone Want to Help Build a Reactor?

abstract: Constellation has backed out of its planned nuclear venture with Electricité de France, and U.S. law requires that every nuclear plant have an American partner as a majority owner.
